executive_summary: Mediation services benefited from economic growth through most of the period, but were negatively affected by the coronavirus. Revenue stagnated at $566.7 billion in the last five years, including a surge of 3.6% in 2023 alone, when profit is set to decrease to 3.3%. Greater demand for practices tied to high-growth sectors has sustained industry revenue over the past five years.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Mediation and Arbitration Offer Clients Alternatives
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Mediation services facilitate the mediation and arbitration process in workplaces. These services offer consumers an alternative way to resolve disputes, rather than going through the traditional court process. While they are both used to solve a legal issue, they differ in process.

Mediation revenue is forecast to swell at a CAGR of 3.2% to $663.7 billion in the next five years. An increasing number of M&As and broad-based economic growth driving up business spending will support revenue growth through corporate law down to mediation services.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Intellectual Property Sustained Revenue From Falling Further
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The accelerated digitization of businesses has contributed to a significant hike in intellectual property (IP) and litigation revenue, driving growth within the industry. Some who want to reduce time and costs in traditional court procedures are seeking mediation and arbitration instead.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Mediation And Arbitration Servicers Are Increasing Efficiency
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Mediation servicers experienced a significant rise in legal technology investments in the past five years, aimed at enhancing efficiency and optimizing operations. By leveraging automation, firms have revolutionized various aspects of legal work, including legal research, document drafting and contract analysis, resulting in more time-effective outcomes.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Intellectual Property Will Stimulate Growth in Revenue
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The accelerated digitization of businesses will continue to contribute to a significant climb in intellectual property (IP) and litigation revenue, driving further growth within the Law Firms industry. This increased demand will fall onto mediation servicers as some will want to reduce time and costs in traditional court procedures.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Mediation and Arbitration Servicers Will Continue Increasing Efficiency
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Mediation services are expected to continue increasing their investments in legal technological investments in the coming years. Mediation servicers can leverage automation to speed up their workflow.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Projected Continued Demand for Corporate Law Will Continue Increasing Demand
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The strong correlation between mediation services' revenue and economic growth will continue driving prosperity in the legal services sector in the coming years, with flourishing businesses and individuals seeking legal guidance. The demand for mediation services will continue benefitting from the increasing number of high-value corporate deals, ultimately propelling the growth of the industry.

industry_definition: Operators in this industry facilitate the mediation and arbitration process in workplaces.
key_trends: Mediation services have experienced a significant rise in legal technology investments aimed at enhancing efficiency and optimizing operations. Mediation services have revolutionized various aspects of legal work, including legal research, document drafting, and contract analysis, resulting in more time-effective outcomes.

Projected continued demand for corporate law will continue increasing demand for mediation services. The strong correlation between mediation services revenue and economic growth will continue driving prosperity in the legal services sector in the coming years.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Governments hire mediators to help resolve disputes within their workforce without going to court. Mediation can be more time- and cost-efficient and less stressful than a regular legal procedure.

Self-employed workers, who are likely more strapped for cash than non-self-employed workers, hire more mediators to save money and time in court. The use of mediation services by self-employed workers has increased in the last few years

Legal services are people in the legal sector that hire mediators. Sometimes it's best for all parties involved to seek conflict resolution through mediation services, even if it means short-term loss for those in this market.
This market consists of healthcare and social assistance workplace hiring mediation services to resolve disputes among their employees.

products_and_services.product_description: Arbitration Services are the Most Popular Products Since consumers can sometimes get binding resolutions

Mediation Services Are Growing In Popularity Mediation is a nonbinding process that is generally conducted with a single mediator who facilitates discussion and a resolution between parties. Consumers seek mediation services to cut costs.

Other Services And Fees Are A Stable Product Segment This segment includes the other services and fees not directly included in arbitration and mediation services. These can include filing fees, hearing fees, administration fees and hearing room rentals.

tier_1_suppliers: Real Estate Investment Trusts in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Corporate profit refers to profit earned across all industries in the United States. When corporate profit increases, businesses are more likely to take on additional workers and external services, such as those provided by the industry. Therefore, a boost in corporate profit typically supports industry revenue.

The number of employees refers to the size of the nonfarm workforce in the United States. Since industry operators service clients throughout all sectors of the economy, a hike in the number of employees increases potential demand for operators.

The number of businesses refers to the total number of businesses in the United States with at least one employee on payroll. An rise in the number of businesses may accelerate demand for industry services since businesses represent potential downstream clients.

The unemployment rate measures the proportion of Americans aged 16 and older who are currently unemployed and looking for work. When the national unemployment rate increases, operators tend to perform fewer transactions for clients, and thus, revenue growth slows. The national unemployment rate is expected to increase.

basis_points.basis_title: Start-up costs in terms of investment in capital are low
basis_points.basis_description: Start-up costs in terms of investment in capital are low. But rent and wage costs can be high in the industry. Costs can also increase with improving computer processes.

basis_points.basis_title: Clients have many companies to choose from
basis_points.basis_description: Since mediation services are highly fragmented, clients have many companies to choose from. This allows buyers to search for a mediation service that suits their needs and price constraints.

basis_points.basis_title: Most players are small- and medium-sized firms
basis_points.basis_description: Mediation services are highly fragmented, with most players being small- and medium-sized firms. Past a certain point for servicing large corporate clients, economies of scale become important.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Mediation services often make more profit when they conduct high-value work for corporations. Rich corporations are able to spend more money to hire mediation services because, regardless of how expensive a mediator might be, it's still likely to be cheaper than using a lawyer in a traditional legal procedure.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The industry is adding new patent technologies at a rate in line with the average across all industries, which suggests a stable addition of technology. However, the concentration of technologies is high. This creates the potential for innovation outside the focus of industry leaders to gain traction.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Major market segments for industry operators are relatively diversified
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The spread of market segments suggests that there are limited entry points other than those already served my incumbent operators.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Mediation services revenue largely moves in line with the performance of the economy and investor confidence. Much of the volatility is associated with changes in financial markets, as many legal fees are generated from equity, debt and capital raisings in addition to merger and acquisition activities.

The emergence of new legal areas resulting from legislative and regulatory changes can significantly impact revenue volatility for mediation services. Major regulatory changes often lead to an increased demand for legal services, particularly in the commercial sector, where businesses must adapt and comply with new laws and regulations.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: ARBITRATION SERVICES ARE THE MOST POPULAR PRODUCTS
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Arbitration more closely imitates a court procedure and is typically conducted with multiple arbitrators who make the final decision on the issue based on the evidence collected. The results of the arbitration process can either be binding or nonbinding, which makes this service more popular than mediation since consumers can get stronger results without the time and cost of a traditional legal procedure.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: MEDIATION SERVICES ARE GROWING IN POPULARITY
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Mediation is a nonbinding process that is generally conducted with a single mediator who facilitates discussion and a resolution between parties. Consumers seek mediation services to cut costs.

FAQs.question: What data is provided in the datatable?
FAQs.answer: The datatable provides yearly data from 2008 to 2019 on revenue, industry value added, number of establishments, enterprises, employment, exports, wages, and domestic demand for the industry. However, some columns like imports and wages have missing data represented by 101.
